ruling_headline: Joe Biden wrong to say Donald Trump has called for carpet bombing
ruling_link_text: Bomb, but not carpet bomb
statement: Says Donald Trump "is going to go out and carpet bomb" the Middle East.

ruling_headline: Biden: Almost right on U.S. workers as the most productive
ruling_link_text: Among the largest economies, yes
statement_context: a speech at the Democratic National Convention
statement: "We have the most productive workers in the world."

ruling_headline: Joe Biden misstates daily deaths in United States from cancer
ruling_link_text: That's the number for the Americas (plural)
statement: "In the United States alone we lose more than 3,000 people a day to cancer."

ruling_headline: Joe Biden says 'vast majority' of international commitments are struck without congressional role
ruling_link_text: It depends on what numbers you use
statement_context: a statement released to the media
statement: "The vast majority of our international commitments take effect without congressional approval."

ruling_headline: Joe Biden and his Somali cab driver friends
ruling_link_text: Whatever Somali community there is in Delaware is minuscule
statement_context: remarks at a White House summit
statement: "There is a very identifiable Somali community" back home in Delaware.

ruling_headline: Joe Biden says Obama policies have cut minority dropout rate by 25 percent
ruling_link_text: Administration policies aren't the only factor
statement_context: a speech to the NAACP in Las Vegas
statement: The Obama administration's policies "have reduced minority dropout rate by 25 percent."

ruling_headline: Biden says he has no stocks, bonds or savings accounts
ruling_link_text: The stocks and bonds are his wife's, but he has a savings account
statement_context: the White House Summit on Working Families
statement: "I don't own a single stock or bond … I have no savings accounts."

ruling_headline: Biden: Since Newtown, more American gun deaths than soldiers lost in Afghanistan
ruling_link_text: Grim numbers, but accurate
statement_context: a tweet from Barack Obama's Twitter feed
statement: "Since Newtown, more people have died at the end of a gun than we have lost in Afghanistan."

ruling_headline: Joe Biden says Paul Ryan cut embassy security by $300 million
ruling_link_text: $300 million in cuts, but not necessarily in Ryan's budget
statement_context: the vice presidential debate in Danville, Ky.
statement: Paul Ryan "cut embassy security in his budget by $300 million below what we asked for."

ruling_headline: Paul Ryan says Biden sympathized and wouldn't second-guess forced abortions and sterilizations
ruling_link_text: Biden doesn't endorse forced abortions
statement: Says Joe Biden "went to China and said that he sympathized and wouldn't second-guess their one-child policy of forced abortions and sterilizations."

ruling_headline: Joe Biden says no Democrats support Paul Ryan’s Medicare proposal
ruling_link_text: Wyden worked with Ryan but doesn't endorse latest plan
statement: "There's not one Democrat who endorses" the Romney-Ryan Medicare plan.

ruling_headline: Biden says 'we weren't told' about Libya security requests
ruling_link_text: The State Department knew
statement: "We weren't told they wanted more security " for diplomatic facilities in Libya.

ruling_headline: Paul Ryan says Obama administration called Bashar Assad 'a reformer'
ruling_link_text: Hillary Clinton was reporting views of others
statement_context: the vice presidential debate in Danville, Ky.
statement: The Obama administration "called Bashar Assad a reformer when he was turning his Russian-provided guns on his own people."

ruling_headline: Biden: Romney called ending the Iraq war 'tragic'
ruling_link_text: He used that word
statement: On ending the war in Iraq, "Gov. Romney said that was a tragic mistake, we should have left 30,000 troops there."

ruling_headline: Joe Biden says Mitt Romney, Paul Ryan would 'eliminate the guarantee of Medicare.'
ruling_link_text: A guarantee today in some ways, not others
statement_context: the vice presidential debate in Danville, Ky.
statement: Says Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan would "eliminate the guarantee of Medicare."

ruling_headline: Joe Biden says Mitt Romney, Paul Ryan would 'eliminate the guarantee of Medicare.'
ruling_link_text: A guarantee today in some ways, not others
statement_context: the vice presidential debate in Danville, Ky.
statement: Says Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan would "eliminate the guarantee of Medicare."

ruling_headline: Biden says most shootings happen with victim’s own gun
ruling_link_text: In fatal shootings, which include suicides
statement: "The bulk of the people who are shot with a weapon — other than these drug gangs taking on one another — end up being shot with their own weapon."

ruling_headline: Joe Biden says people earning $200,000 already pay 30 percent tax rate
ruling_link_text: Blurs two different types of tax rates
statement: The 30 percent tax rate called for under President Barack Obama’s proposed Buffett Rule "is lower than the prescribed tax rate for millionaires already -- not just for millionaires, for people making over $200,000."

ruling_headline: Vice President Joe Biden says, 'General Motors is the largest corporation in the world'
ruling_link_text: Not No. 1, or even No. 10
statement: "General Motors is the largest corporation in the world again."

ruling_headline: Joe Biden says Iraq violence 'is down to an all-time low' since start of war
ruling_link_text: Most statistics back him up
statement: In Iraq, "violence is down to an all-time low" since the start of the war.

ruling_headline: Biden says middle income earners lost ground before the recession
ruling_link_text: Decline in median income predated recession
statement_context: speaking at New Hampshire’s Plymouth State University
statement: "The median income of a middle class family went down $2,100 from 2001 to 2007."

ruling_headline: Biden calls Libya a job well done
ruling_link_text: The costs were relatively low
statement_context: a talk at Plymouth State University in Plymouth, N.H.
statement: In Libya, "America spent $2 billion total and didn’t lose a single life."

ruling_headline: Joe Biden says murders and rapes increased in Flint, Mich., after the police force was reduced
ruling_link_text: UPDATE: Murders up, but not rapes
statement: "In 2008, when Flint had 265 sworn officers on their police force, there were 35 murders and 91 rapes in this city. In 2010, when Flint had only 144 police officers, the murder rate climbed to 65, and rapes … climbed to 229."

ruling_headline: Joe Biden says that closing Amtrak's Northeast Corridor would force I-95 to expand by seven lanes
ruling_link_text: The mathematical models vary quite a bit
statement: "If you shut down Amtrak's Northeast Corridor, it's estimated you'd have to add seven new lanes to I-95 to accommodate the increased traffic."

ruling_headline: Joe Biden says he never called for partition of Iraq
ruling_link_text: Three semi-autonomous regions; but one central government
statement: "I never called for a partition" of Iraq.

ruling_headline: Joe Biden says health care approval increasing
ruling_link_text: They're up and down
statement_context: an interview on ABC's This Week
statement: "The health care numbers are going up."

ruling_headline: Joe Biden says U.S. 'is not engaged in nation-building' in Afghanistan
ruling_link_text: If it quacks like nation-building...
statement_context: an interview on ABC's This Week
statement: "We're not engaged in nation-building" in Afghanistan.

ruling_headline: Joe Biden lauds Obama's job creation record
ruling_link_text: He's pretty close
statement: "We went from losing 3 million jobs in the last six months of the Bush Administration," adding almost 600,000 private sector jobs in the first six months of the year.

ruling_headline: Biden says job losses have fallen from 750,000 per month to 35,000 per month
ruling_link_text: He's off slightly for the three months prior to signing
statement: "In the three months before the act took effect, America lost 750,000 jobs a month. In the last three months, we've lost about 35,000 jobs a month."

ruling_headline: Two of three convicted in military commissions have been released
ruling_link_text: Two have been released to foreign countries
statement: "There have been three people tried and convicted by the last administration in military courts. Two are walking the street right now."

ruling_headline: Biden overstates role of Medicare, Medicaid in U.S. health care spending
ruling_link_text: He used a valid number, but erred in defining it
statement_context: an interview on NBC's 'Meet the Press'
statement: Among the money spent on health care in the United States, "46 cents on every dollar spent is through Medicare and Medicaid."

ruling_headline: Biden says every Senate decision now requires 60 votes
ruling_link_text: Cloture votes more common, but not that common
statement: "As long as I have served . . . This is the first time every single solitary decision has required 60 senators."

ruling_headline: Vice President  Biden claims $174 billion of stimulus has been committed
ruling_link_text: Close, but not quite that much
statement: "Across the country, $174 billion of the Recovery Act have been committed in its first 130 days."

ruling_headline: Biden wrong on the way germs travel through an aircraft
ruling_link_text: A couple of rows, maybe.
statement: "When one person sneezes, it goes all the way through the aircraft."

ruling_headline: Biden points out disparities between CEO and average worker pay
ruling_link_text: Only "literally" true with qualifiers
statement_context: a speech in Miami Beach, Fla.
statement: "The average CEO makes $10,000 more every day ... than what the average worker makes every year."

ruling_headline: The rich are, in fact, getting richer
ruling_link_text: The rich are, in fact, getting richer
statement: "One percent of the American people make over 21 percent of all the income in America. That wasn’t the way before George Bush became president."

ruling_headline: McCain opposed 2007 war funding bill
ruling_link_text: McCain opposed 2007 war funding bill
statement_context: a debate in St. Louis, Mo.
statement: "John McCain voted against funding the troops because of . . . a timeline in it to draw down American troops."

ruling_headline: McCain refused to commit
ruling_link_text: McCain refused to commit
statement: John McCain said "he wouldn't even sit down with the government of Spain, a NATO ally that has troops in Afghanistan with us now."

ruling_headline: Biden more or less right on McCain's subprime surprise
ruling_link_text: Biden more or less right on McCain's subprime surprise
statement: "John McCain said...in December he was surprised there was a subprime mortgage problem."

ruling_headline: McCain's tax plan doesn't ignore middle class
ruling_link_text: McCain's tax plan doesn't ignore middle class
statement_context: vice presidential debate in St. Louis
statement: Sen. McCain's tax plan provides "virtually nothing to the middle class."

ruling_headline: McCain supported Republican-backed investigation
ruling_link_text: McCain supported Republican-backed investigation
statement: "When George Bush said we shouldn't investigate why the government's response to Hurricane Katrina was so incompetent, John McCain stood with him."

ruling_headline: It's not quite that simple
ruling_link_text: It's not quite that simple
statement_context: a speech at the Democratic National Convention in Denver
statement: McCain supports tax breaks for companies that ship jobs overseas.

ruling_headline: 100-million people is more accurate
ruling_link_text: 100-million people is more accurate
statement: John McCain's tax plan will give no reduction "for 100-million American families."

ruling_headline: The Democrats counted correctly
ruling_link_text: The Democrats counted correctly
statement_context: a speech at the Democratic National Convention in Denver
statement: McCain voted 19 times against a minimum-wage increase.

ruling_headline: Biden digs back on Afghanistan to dig McCain
ruling_link_text: Biden digs back on Afghanistan to dig McCain
statement_context: a speech at the Democratic National Convention in Denver
statement: Three years ago, John McCain said, "Afghanistan — we don't read about it anymore in papers because it succeeded."

ruling_headline: McCain has often opposed timelines, but not always
ruling_link_text: McCain has often opposed timelines, but not always
statement: (McCain) says "we can't have ... timelines to draw down our troops from Iraq."

ruling_headline: Five are more senior, 40 are older
ruling_link_text: Five are more senior, 40 are older
statement: "There's only four senators senior to me ... there's still 44 older than me."

ruling_headline: He seems interested
ruling_link_text: He seems interested
statement: On whether he wants to be vice president.

ruling_headline: That's what McCain said -- in 2005
ruling_link_text: That's what McCain said -- in 2005
statement: Says McCain once said that on "the most important issues of our day, I've been totally in agreement and support of President Bush."

ruling_headline: Cherry-picking McCain's record
ruling_link_text: Cherry-picking McCain's record
statement: Says McCain "supported George Bush's policies 95 percent of the time."

ruling_headline: McCain doesn't flip-flop much on Iraq
ruling_link_text: McCain doesn't flip-flop much on Iraq
statement: John McCain has changed position on invading Iraq.

ruling_headline: Obama sponsored a bill that became law
ruling_link_text: Obama sponsored a bill that became law
statement_context: a campaign event in Ames, Iowa
statement: "Barack Obama hasn't passed any (bills)."

ruling_headline: Clinton's work has been low profile
ruling_link_text: Clinton's work has been low profile
statement_context: a campaign event in Ames, Iowa
statement: "There's not a major bill I know with Hillary's name on it."

ruling_headline: Edwards a significant player on several bills
ruling_link_text: Edwards a significant player on several bills
statement_context: a campaign event in Ames, Iowa
statement: "John doesn't have a record in the Senate. John's only passed four bills. They're all about post offices."

ruling_headline: He was one voice of many
ruling_link_text: He was one voice of many
statement: Biden was responsible for "ending genocide in Bosnia."

ruling_headline: Yes, Biden spoke first
ruling_link_text: Yes, Biden spoke first
statement: "When Pakistan erupted in crisis, I spoke to Musharraf before Bush did."

ruling_headline: Rudy has run the nation's largest city
ruling_link_text: Rudy has run the nation's largest city
statement: Rudy Giuliani is "probably the most underqualified man since George Bush to seek the presidency."

ruling_headline: Call the exaggeration police
ruling_link_text: Call the exaggeration police
statement: "In the 1990s, the Biden Crime Bill added 100,000 cops to America's streets. As a result, murder and violent crime rates went down eight years in a row."

ruling_headline: Trying to out-Rudy Rudy
ruling_link_text: Trying to out-Rudy Rudy
statement: "Here's a man who brags about how he made the city safe. It was the Biden crime bill that became the Clinton crime bill that allowed him to do that."

ruling_headline: Richardson first said it might work
ruling_link_text: Richardson first said it might work
statement: "First, he was in favor of my plan, now he's attacking it."

ruling_headline: Richardson now opposes residual troops
ruling_link_text: Richardson now opposes residual troops
statement: "First, he said he would leave residual forces in Iraq, and now he says he wouldn't."

ruling_headline: Richardson defaults to 'fast as possible'
ruling_link_text: Richardson defaults to 'fast as possible'
statement: "First, he said he would take all of our troops out in six months, and now he acknowledges it would take a year."

ruling_headline: Biden right on SCHIP
ruling_link_text: Biden right on SCHIP
statement: "With one stroke of his pen, President Bush has denied health insurance to 3.8 million kids who were due to get it under this bipartisan expansion of the Children's Health Insurance Program."

ruling_headline: Biden way off on alcohol-related birth defects
ruling_link_text: Biden way off on alcohol-related birth defects
statement: "There are 300,000 babies born deformed every year in this country because of women who are alcoholics while they're carrying those children to term."

ruling_headline: First with details, but it's not the "only" plan
ruling_link_text: First with details, but it's not the "only" plan
statement: "Joe Biden is the only candidate with a plan to get us out of Iraq and keep us out."

ruling_headline: Biden right: No fast way out.
ruling_link_text: Biden right: No fast way out.
statement: "You know we can't just pull out now... The truth of the matter is: If we started today, it would take one year, one year to get 160,000 troops physically out of Iraq, logistically."

ruling_headline: Irresponsible claim (and wrong medical diagnosis)
ruling_link_text: Irresponsible claim (and wrong medical diagnosis)
statement: "The president is brain-dead."

ruling_headline: New trucks are safer, but how much?
ruling_link_text: New trucks are safer, but how much?
statement: "Roadside bombs are responsible for 70 percent of casualties in Iraq and these new mine-resistant vehicles can reduce those casualties by two-thirds."
